metadata.name: Active FE 1 mcg mL Injection solution concentrate

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used in preventing and treating iron deficiency anemia

contraindications.disease: Acute iron overdosage can be divided into four stages In the first stage which occurs up to six hours after ingestion the principal symptoms are vomiting and diarrhea Other symptoms include hypotension tachycardia and CNS depression ranging from lethargy to coma The second phase may occur at 6 24 hours after ingestion and is characterized by a temporary remission In the third phase gastrointestinal symptoms recur accompanied by shock metabolic acidosis coma hepatic necrosis and jaundice hypoglycemia renal failure and pulmonary edema The fourth phase may occur several weeks after ingestion and is characterized by gastrointestinal obstruction and liver damage In a young child 75 milligrams per kilogram is considered extremely dangerous A dose of 30 milligrams per kilogram can lead to symptoms of toxicity Estimates of a lethal dosage range from 180 milligrams per kilogram and upwards A peak serum iron concentration of five micrograms or more per ml is associated with moderate to severe poisoning in many
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: The major activity of supplemental iron is in the prevention and treatment of iron deficiency anemia Iron has putative immune enhancing anticarcinogenic and cognition enhancing activities

incompatibilities.description: Dimercaprol may increase the nephrotoxic activities of Iron
